title: Calligraphy, "Fragments of a Manuscript Written in the Shan Language of  Myanmar", possibly before 1862
description: Two leaves from a larger manuscript, joined at the left side, attached to which is a note written in ink: "two leaves cut from a book containing the history of a pious nun, written in the Shan language.  They are a tribe living in a mountainous district of Burmah [sic] along the Sittang River.  It is just one year since the gospel was preached to them. June 20th" (written by Joseph Parrish, Jr.).

tombstone.epitaph: Calligraphy, "Fragments of a Manuscript Written in the Shan Language of  Myanmar", possibly before 1862. Black ink on thin paper. 1962-88-1.
